text: Good movie. Great add to the others.

**Review:**

As a long-time *Bad Boys* fan, I walked into *Bad Boys for Life* with cautious hype—and walked out grinning. Seeing Will Smith and Martin Lawrence back after all these years feels like cinematic comfort food, and directors Adil & Bilal handle the reunion with style. The plot’s the strongest of the trilogy for me: Mike nearly killed, hunting down his would-be assassin, while Marcus fumbles with retirement and comic relief. The balance of heavier drama and buddy banter works surprisingly well. It’s weightier than the first two films, but that tension pays off. Adil & Bilal honor Michael Bay’s flashy chaos while putting their own stamp on it. Not perfect, but it earns its stripes. Roll on the next one.

**Recommendation:** Worth a watch for fans.
**Next step:** Queue it up before the sequel drops.

total trash from start to finish, most stupid movie ever, worst in the bad boys movie, a horrible plot to a god awful villainess  i ever seen in a movie, everything about this movie sucked, and what up with the intro you were expecting to them catch a criminal nope they are late to a birth of a child yep they use emergency vehicles from them to speed threw the town and this put me off for the rest of the movie, then you meet the villain of the movie and yep its getting worst and worst and worst as the movie goes

Well it's better than 2 I guess but it's just a forgettable legacy franchise entry at the end of the day. The music is decent but it feels like it's just trying to recapture the tunes from the first one. Everything else is just alright. It's totally watchable and feels almost like a Fast & Furious sequel in a sense with the hammed in family themes and over the top action. This starts out kind of good actually and the best moments are the serious family heart to heart moments with Lawrence and Smith. Too bad those all but disappear in the second half. Lots of the action scenes is stuff we've seen before and suffer the same problem 2 did where they drag on longer than they should. The main duo is decent but everyone else is just so forgettable, used as plot vehicles, or barely given much time. The biggest problem here is the bloated plot. This tries to fit in sooooo much and feels like a daytime soap opera with guns and explosions. The baby, retirement, Smith's injury which is all but glossed over, mortality, the son twist which is sooooo stupid, farfetched and over the top. And than add on a Cartel plot that's convuluted with Ammo thrown in and than jumping around half the time between the two and it just gets so jumpy, over the top, and isn't so much hard to follow but just bloated and farfetched. Than sequel baiting at the end like a F&F movie. The ending and the villian feels like villian you'd see in a fantasy movie almost with how the end fight is done and is a CGI fest. It's never incoherent or boring though as most bad daytime soap operas go. But still skip this. It's a forgettable action flick at the end of the day. Disappointing trilogy entry.
Bad Boys For Life (2020) It has action, comedy, and a good runtime. This franchise manages to deliver a good cast with great performances. This film is the best so far.
Reggie was a beast in this movie.

The best movie in the entire movie franchise. This movie starts out with a bang with the prison escape and Mike being shot and ends with a bang with an amazing climax that had a helicopter crash through the building. The series took a brake for a while and when it came back it picked up where they left off and just climbed higher the before. Will Smith and Martin Lawrence are wonderful to watch.
